intro: Sanvitalia versicolor, commonly known as the Mexican blanket flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its vibrant blossoms, which range in color from red to orange and yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer. Sanvitalia versicolor is also known for its drought tolerance and ability to reseed itself, making it a hardy and low-maintenance plant.
